item.title: What to do if your mortgage payments haven't gone down despite an RBA rate cut
item.description: You might assume home loan repayments will automatically reduce when an interest rate cut is passed on, but this isn’t always the case. Here's how to check.

item.title: Here's how Labor's revised super proposal would work
item.description: Every prominent criticism of the tax has been addressed, with the result that it will apply to fewer people and raise less money.

item.title: Major review of medical scans at Caboolture Hospital to include 3,500 more patients
item.description: Thousands more patients have been caught up in a bungle involving medical scans not being reviewed by doctors at a major south-east Queensland hospital.

item.title: Jesse Southwell signs with Broncos amid fears of lopsided NRLW competition
item.description: NSW State of Origin halfback Jesse Southwell's two-year deal with the Brisbane Broncos may add to the debate about the NRLW's competitiveness since it expanded to 12 teams.

item.title: Lidia Thorpe's 'burn down Parliament House' remark faces AFP probe
item.description: The Australian Federal Police has issued a rare statement confirming it is investigating whether independent senator Lidia Thorpe broke any laws by saying she was prepared to "burn down Parliament House" in support of Palestinians.

item.title: Former teacher Rodney Neville Watkins guilty of sexually abusing boys in Perth
item.description: A former teacher is found guilty of sexually abusing primary school-aged boys in Perth, and one on Rottnest Island, in the 1970s in 1980s.

item.title: Hamas releases all remaining Israeli hostages in Gaza, IDF confirms
item.description: Israel says Hamas has handed over all 20 living hostages in the first phase of the Israel-Gaza ceasefire agreement.

item.title: Dolphin calf rescued after spending weeks tangled in fishing line
item.description: Marine rescuers issue an urgent plea for people to responsibly dispose of fishing gear after freeing a dolphin calf from a fishing line.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds mindful they need to lift against New Zealand's Silver Ferns in Constellation Cup
item.description: Despite the comfortable series win over South Africa, Australia is mindful it will need to step up a gear in the Constellation Cup against New Zealand.

item.title: Tatiana Dokhotaru told triple-0 her ex-partner was 'trying to kill' her before alleged murder, court hears
item.description: Danny Zayat has pleaded not guilty over the alleged murder of his former partner Tatiana Dokhotaru on May 26, 2023, in a high-rise complex in Sydney's south-west.

item.title: Woodside North West Shelf gas project extension challenged in Federal Court
item.description: Two separate appeals are launched in the Federal Court in a bid to overturn Environment Minister Murray Watt's approval of Woodside's gas hub extension on the North West Shelf.

item.title: SA Premier says algal bloom is not 'toxic', despite word appearing in official government advice
item.description: South Australia's Premier has questioned the use of the word "toxic" to describe the state's ongoing algal bloom, despite the word being used in government advice and by scientists researching it.

item.title: John Torney's mother gives evidence in his manslaughter committal hearing
item.description: John Torney's committal hearing begins as his mother tells the court she was the one who called police to check on the woman before her body was found.

item.title: Who's in and who's out in Sussan Ley's new shadow cabinet
item.description: The changes follow two high-profile departures from shadow cabinet within a month.

item.title: Inside Victoria's escalating crime wave, where a car is reported stolen to insurers every 44 minutes
item.description: A rise in car theft and carjackings in this state has also seen parents left terrorised as cars are taken with their children inside.

item.title: New testimony seeks to shed light on mysterious death of Mark Haines
item.description: An inquest has heard evidence contradicting the story told by a driver whose crashed car was found near the body of Mark Anthony Haines almost four decades ago.

item.title: Frustration mounts among Qantas customers as personal data released on dark web
item.description: The airline's customers voice their concerns and disappointment after cybercriminals release their personal data on the dark web.

item.title: England provides the blueprint for 2029 Women's Rugby World Cup in Australia
item.description: The recently concluded Women's Rugby World Cup in England took the game to new heights. But, as Alicia Lucas writes, Australia needs to take big strides to ensure its hosting of the tournament in 2029 continues to raise the bar.

item.description: The deal comes as one group representing hostages accuses Hamas of breaching aspects of the ceasefire agreement, with the remains of 24 hostages yet to be returned to Israel.

item.description: Fossil fuel companies and governments argue it's not possible to link climate impacts to specific projects, but Australian researchers have done the numbers.

item.title: Why Santos is behind your soaring electricity and mortgage costs
item.description: It was a primary force behind Australia’s inflationary surge, it’s forced businesses either to the wall or to shift offshore, undermined national industry policy and resulted in the loss of countless thousands of jobs. And it all hinged on one disastrous decision in an Adelaide boardroom.

item.title: Outback golf tournament brings together 150 players to support Royal Flying Doctor Service
item.description: There are no manicured greens in sight, but this golf tournament brings more than 150 players to an outback sheep station to raise funds for the Royal Flying Doctor Service.

item.title: Advocates call for better measure of poverty, saying Australia's approach falls short
item.description: We get detailed measurements of population, participation and productivity. Advocates want to add a fourth "p" — poverty — so we can understand our economy.

item.description: Israel's military says Hamas has returned the bodies of four hostages from Gaza, with the remains of 24 others yet to be returned — as it happened.

item.title: The political theatre of Donald Trump's Middle East trip masks glaring questions about the peace plan
item.description: Donald Trump's unconventional and often haphazard approach to diplomacy means there are countless questions about what has driven him to date, and what might determine whether he stays engaged in the Middle East peace process in the future.

item.title: Youth crime rates in the bush still high as leaders look for solutions
item.description: Official figures show youth crime is decreasing across NSW, but that does not ring true in some rural communities.

item.title: Cape Verde qualifies for 2026 FIFA World Cup in United States, Canada and Mexico
item.description: Cape Verde will play in the men's FIFA World Cup for the first time after beating Eswatini 3-0 to win its group in African qualifying for the 2026 showpiece.

item.description: Israelis gather to watch a historic day unfold as hostages held for two years are finally set free.

item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers confirms he spoke with former prime minister Paul Keating last week ahead of the government's U-turn on superannuation.

item.description: Experts warn Roblox has a predator problem, amid reports Australian children are being exposed to a range of disturbing experiences on the platform.

item.description: A gas company operating in the Northern Territory has been accused of breaching environmental laws by an NT government department, which decided against prosecution in favour of a formal letter encouraging "behaviour change".

item.description: Music exams and competitions aren't easy, but our experts have some tips to make the process as stress-free as possible, including managing performance anxiety.

item.description: The big three of Zach Merrett, Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca remain in limbo with one day left in the trade period, with Brayden Fiorini going from Gold Coast to Essendon the main move of the day.

item.description: Alexei Popyrin's ATP Tour return has ended with defeat as Australia's second-highest-ranked men's player returns following a back injury.

item.description: Former senator Linda Reynolds files a creditor's petition in the Federal Court against her ex-staffer, Brittany Higgins, as she tries to recover damages awarded to her for defamation.

item.title: Midnight Oil fans rally to keep Rob Hirst's drum kit 'in public hands' at charity auction
item.description: Midnight Oil drummer Rob Hirst auctions off the kit, which he has had since 1979, saying he can no longer play it because of his battle with pancreatic cancer.

item.title: Plans for national art gallery in Alice Springs scrapped after government rift
item.description: The Northern Territory government scraps controversial plans to build the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Gallery of Australia in Alice Springs after nine years of back and forth.

item.title: Tougher jail sentences needed to address record crime in Victoria, police union says
item.description: The Police Association welcomes the Victorian chief commissioner's new strategy to get more officers on the streets, but says tougher sentences the only effective solution to crime crisis.

item.title: Endangered powerful owl among 'sound bath' of bird calls captured by recordings
item.description: Powerful owls prey on possums, and even koalas, but local bird watchers are excited by the discovery of new pairs in South Australia.

item.title: Man charged after alleged carjackings, dramatic pursuit in Melbourne CBD
item.description: Police say the gun a man pointed at people in Melbourne on Tuesday was a fake firearm. They have charged him with multiple offences following an alleged carjacking spree through the city.

item.title: When to share the news of a pregnancy with your employer
item.description: Experts on the rules around when you need to inform your employer if you’re planning to take parental leave.

item.title: Australia call up Josh Philippe and Matt Kuhnemann for ODI against India
item.description: Josh Philippe is set to play his first ODI for Australia in four years, after Josh Inglis failed to recover from his calf strain in time for the series opener against India.

item.title: Victorian Liberals to scrap statewide Treaty if elected
item.description: The Victorian Liberals will scrap the state's proposed Treaty agreement with First Peoples' if elected. The opposition had previously withdrawn support for the proposed agreement, which is set to be debated in Parliament today and is expected to pass with the support of Labor and the Greens.

item.title: Dave Hughes back in hospital with lung issues six weeks after AFL Legends match
item.description: Comedian Dave Hughes has returned to hospital, six weeks after suffering five broken ribs and a punctured lung in the AFL's Legends game.

item.title: Governments announce full details of $102.5m algal bloom summer plan
item.description: Large scale reef restoration, new real-time water monitoring and a $1 million trial of "AI-powered submersible cytobots" are part of a $102.5 million government algal bloom program to ensure "South Australians can enjoy their summer".

item.title: The Hobart Clinic offered government funding lifeline to stay open for six months
item.description: A southern Tasmanian private mental health clinic will remain open for at least six months after securing $2 million in government funding while it explores a new business model.

item.title: Woman dies in house fire at Bellingen, west of Coffs Harbour
item.description: A 78-year-old woman escapes a blaze on the NSW Mid North Coast, but the body of another woman — believed to be her daughter who lived with disability — is later found inside.

item.title: Children under 16 will soon be banned from social media — as it happened
item.description: From December, children under 16 will be blocked from accessing social media. Take a look back at our live coverage.

item.title: Mount Buffalo National Park reopens as search for alleged gunman Dezi Freeman continues
item.description: Victoria Police says its search for alleged gunman Dezi Freeman will continue as the Mount Buffalo National Park partially reopens.

item.title: Homicide detectives investigate discovery of man's body in Armidale
item.description: Police are eager to speak to a second man who was taken to hospital, after the body of a man believed to be in his 70s was found at a home on the NSW northern tablelands.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's mobile phone number made available online

item.title: Australia's Antarctic icebreaker RSV Nuyina 'makes contact with ocean floor' near remote Heard Island
item.description: Antarctic icebreaker RSV Nuyina has headed to deeper waters off remote Heard Island in the Southern Ocean while assessments are undertaken to see if the hull has suffered any damage after scraping the ocean floor.

item.description: Nathan Buckley takes a surprise assistant coaching job as the Collingwood legend awaits on a likely offer to lead Tasmania's inaugural AFL team.

item.description: Parts of Pilbara and Kimberley surpassed 40 degrees Celsius yesterday but meteorologists say the temperatures will not trigger a heatwave warning yet.

item.description: Nikita Tszyu was involved in a car accident last weekend, putting a possible grudge match fight against Michael Zerafa at risk.

item.description: The mayor of a small council that lost nearly $2 million in a "sophisticated" scam says international fraudsters were able to "imitate personalities" using AI.

item.title: Eugowra flood inquest hears evidence of a 'day of hell'

item.description: A man is in custody and homicide detectives are investigating following the death of a man in Perth's northern suburbs.

item.title: Suggestion AFLW being used as a 'trial run' for new rules causes frustration
item.description: Collingwood's Tarni White says it feels as though the women's competition is being used as a trial run for new rules before they are implemented into the men's league.

item.description: After meter reader Kane Minion was fatally mauled by dogs at a Queensland property, the Coroners Court hears details about the electricity provider's work procedures.

item.description: The Socceroos' friendly against the United States is a positive step in their World Cup preparation, while a positive result could also influence their tournament draw.

item.title: Parts of Coffs Coast Wildlife Sanctuary evacuated due to 'highly venomous' sea snake
item.description: Visitors to a northern New South Wales wildlife sanctuary were forced to evacuate after a woman brought in a rescued sea snake, one of the world's deadliest reptiles.

item.title: As illicit tobacco sales rise into the billions, economist Arthur Laffer puts blame on high tobacco taxation rate
item.description: Internal tobacco industry data estimates the illicit tobacco market now makes up 64 per cent of all tobacco consumed in Australia and 82 per cent of the total nicotine consumed.

item.title: Bangladesh garment factory fire kills 16, toll may rise, official says
item.description: At least 16 people have died after a fire broke out in a garment factory and a nearby chemical warehouse in Bangladesh.

item.title: Safety liner under US military fuel tanks in Darwin still failing, weeks after NT government approval
item.description: Groundwater is leaking through the safety liner under some of the fuel facility's 11 tanks, which were constructed unlawfully on Darwin Harbour without a building permit. It comes after the NT government approved the tanks for operation in September.

item.title: Instagram to limit teens to PG-13 content, Meta says
item.description: Teenagers on Instagram will be restricted to seeing PG-13 content by default and won't be able to change their settings without a parent's permission, Meta has announced.

item.title: Coroner makes rare public statement as NSW records most Indigenous deaths in custody in a year
item.description: NSW Coroner Teresa O'Sullivan's rare public comment on the "entrenched over-representation" of Indigenous prisoners as the state records the most ever in a single year, is welcomed by the grieving family member of a man who died in prison.

item.title: LGBTQIA+ groups 'horrified' by NT leader's comments about not detaining transgender women in female prisons
item.description: The Northern Territory government has doubled down on its stance against detaining transgender women in female prisons, as a local LGBTQIA+ group says it is "horrified" by the comments.

item.title: RBA chief economist's inflation warning dims interest rate cut expectations, ASX rallies — as it happened
item.description: The Reserve Bank's Sarah Hunter says underlying inflation was likely stronger than the RBA had anticipated last quarter, striking another blow to expectations of further interest rate cuts. The ASX has closed up 1 per cent.

item.title: Victorian volunteer firefighter numbers grow despite levy angst
item.description: Despite resentment and anger from some farmers, the CFA says it's well prepared to deal with an elevated fire risk this spring and summer.

item.title: Stuart Broad says Australian cricket team at its 'weakest' ahead of Ashes series against England
item.description: Stuart Broad lights the fuse ahead of the men's Ashes series, saying England has its best chance of winning in Australia since the 2010/11 series.

item.description: Victoria's triple-0 dispatch software fails due to a power outage, forcing operators to take notes with pen and paper.

item.title: Prosthetics clients of Jack McDonald question what legal rights they have for compensation
item.description: A prosthetics provider has left Australians thousands of dollars out of pocket, some having to cope with ill-fitting or wrong-coloured fingers and eyes.

item.title: Driver Joash Alec Green jailed for seven years over manslaughter of cousin in Pilbara highway crash
item.description: A Kimberley man is sentenced over the unlawful killing of his cousin in a road crash while attempting to overtake and under the influence of alcohol.

item.title: Herald Sun defends reporting as court battle approaches with Liberal MP Sam Groth
item.description: The Herald Sun newspaper has defended its reporting about deputy leader of the Victorian Liberal Party Sam Groth and his wife as it prepares for a defamation lawsuit in the Federal Court.

item.title: Regional Victorian farmers left high and dry as decent spring rain fails to arrive
item.description: Some Victorian farmers are cutting crops for hay as the drought continues to bite in the nation's south-east.

item.title: Illawarrra Academy of Sport holds open testing day for aspiring young athletes
item.description: Young athletes wanting to be the next Emma McKeon or Jessica Hull have been put through high-performance testing to see if they have what it takes to be a professional.

item.title: Japan makes history as Brazil records 'unacceptable' 3-2 loss in international friendly
item.description: For the first time in 14 meetings, Japan defeats Brazil 3-2 in their international friendly at a sold-out Tokyo Stadium.

item.title: Queensland health minister knew of hospital failures before going on leave
item.description: Queensland's health minister has revealed he knew about failures at Caboolture Hospital involving the death of a patient after delays to medical scan results, before he went on holiday when the issue later became public.

item.title: WA's Coolgardie council avoids suspension, with residents expressing frustration and relief over the saga
item.description: Coolgardie Shire leaders hope to rebuild trust among ratepayers after the local government minister announced the WA state government would not suspend the council.

item.title: Woman, two children, confirmed dead in Gladstone house fire
item.description: Police are still investigating the cause of a fatal house fire in Gladstone this morning.

item.title: England thrashes Latvia 5-0 to qualify for World Cup finals
item.description: Unbeaten in its qualifying matches, England reaches next year's World Cup finals following a dominant 5-0 defeat of Latvia.

item.title: Hundreds of Victorians are graduating as paramedics, but have to go interstate for jobs
item.description: For regional paramedicine graduates, finding a job, let alone one in your hometown, is a challenge.

item.title: Police charge man with murder over death in Hocking in Perth's north
item.description: Police charge a 27-year-old man with murder over the death of a 58-year-old man who suffered significant stab wounds during an altercation at a home in Hocking.

item.title: Alleged South-East Asian scammers targeted by US over huge investment swindle
item.description: A Chinese national accused of being the mastermind behind one of the largest ever investment frauds has been charged in the US.

item.title: Gaps in cyberbullying reporting leave parents feeling lost, struggling to find answers
item.description: Parents and carers are frustrated by what they say is a lack of support when trying to report several Instagram accounts targeting children under the age of 17 over the school holidays.

item.title: Queensland Health issues public health alert as person dies after ingesting rare nitazene
item.description: A second person has died this month after ingesting a synthetic opioid in Queensland, raising concerns about the safety of thousands of teenagers during Schoolies celebrations in coming weeks.

item.description: Randa Abdel-Fattah explores the experience of Palestinian Australians in Discipline, her first book for adults.

item.title: Socceroos lose 2-1 to USA in international friendly, ending Tony Popovic's unbeaten start
item.description: The Socceroos suffer defeat for the first time under Tony Popovic, falling to a 2-1 defeat against the USA in Colorado.

item.title: Auditor-general report shows SA government's $285m hydrogen spend
item.description: South Australia's Office for Hydrogen Power spent more than $280 million before the state government scrapped the agency amid the failure of its Whyalla hydrogen project, an auditor-general report tabled in parliament has found.

item.title: High Court upholds minister's decision to block visa for American commentator Candace Owens

item.title: Federal government urged to deny visa to rapist and beach volleyballer Steven van de Velde
item.description: South Australia's Attorney-General has written to the federal government urging it to block the entry into Australia of convicted Dutch child rapist Steven van de Velde, who is seeking to compete at the upcoming Beach Volleyball World Championships.

item.title: AFL trade period, deadline day live updates: Zach Merrett, Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca among big names on the move
item.description: Deadline day of the AFL trade period has arrived, with clubs racing the clock to complete deals today. Does Zach Merrett get to Hawthorn, or Charlie Curnow to Sydney? Find out live.

item.title: Rockhampton man charged after allegedly stabbing two men at sports club
item.description: Police allege a 21-year-old man stabbed two men at a Rockhampton sports club and threatened another man in unprovoked attacks.

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann ordered into mediation over funds for lawyers he hired following anti-corruption raids
item.description: The Federal Court orders mediation for former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann over funding he says he was offered to pay for his lawyers.

item.title: The US has dropped out of the top 10 most powerful passports — but where does Australia rank?
item.description: The US passport has fallen to 12th place, a five-spot decline from its previous ranking, tying with Malaysia.

item.title: Police officer drew gun on dog after fatal mauling of meter reader Kane Minion, inquest hears
item.description: The inquest into the death of Kane Minion hears that investigators feared for their safety when visiting the property where the 2022 attack occurred.

item.title: Powerhouse misses opportunity to get Melbourne-bound drums of Sydney's Midnight Oil
item.description: Midnight Oil are Sydney rock royalty, but the drum kit that stuck with the band for more than 40 years is heading to a Melbourne music museum.

item.title: Brian Barnes pleads not guilty to murder of Quambatook woman Merril Kelly
item.description: Brian Barnes, 67, is accused of the murder of Merril Kelly, 70, whose body was found by firefighters after a grassfire near a cemetery in the small Victorian town in January.

item.description: A crime and corruption investigation into former Townsville mayor Troy Thompson has been finished, weeks away from a by-election he is expected to contest.

item.title: Conjoined boys born in PNG bound for Australia for medical treatment
item.description: The boys, who are only the second known case of conjoined twins born in PNG, are expected to come to Australia for medical treatment.

item.description: Investigators are probing links between a haul of drugs seized on Tuesday and the South-East Asian gang allegedly behind a failed hit in Western Sydney last week.

item.title: SES critical of weather bureau, Eugowra flood inquest told
item.description: The third day of an inquest into two deaths during the 2022 Eugowra flood hears of concerns raised within the SES about the accuracy of weather bureau warnings.

item.title: Federal government puts states, territories on notice over failure to close the gap for Indigenous people
item.description: The federal Indigenous minister may impose penalties on states and territories that fail to meet critical targets for the National Agreement on Closing the Gap.

item.description: Donald Trump made the comments in reference to Time magazine's upcoming November cover story, detailing how his administration "sealed the Gaza ceasefire deal".

item.description: The baby recession in Australia is deepening as cost of living pressures make the decision for people to have children less of a choice.

item.description: A teenager in youth custody over the murders of Dau Akueng and Chol Achiek is forcibly arrested by police after he repeatedly refused to attend court.

item.description: Sean Abbott becomes the latest Test hopeful to suffer an injury, ruled out of NSW's Sheffield Shield match after splitting the webbing on his bowling hand.

item.title: Tasmania's troubled Spirit of Tasmania IV ship unable to berth at Point Henry in Geelong, report finds
item.description: The ABC understands that a recent safety assessment found the interim berth would need two additional bollards for the ship to dock there, at a cost of $2 million.
